references.paper_title: Spectrally-normalized margin bounds for neural networks
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical guarantees for the effectiveness of the proposed method in the presence of missing values, which is a critical aspect of the research.

references.paper_title: Exact matrix completion via convex optimization
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel method that integrates data imputation with anomaly detection into a unified optimization problem, addressing a critical challenge in handling incomplete data.

references.paper_title: Maximum likelihood from incomplete data via the EM algorithm
references.reason: This foundational paper provides the theoretical basis for many state-of-the-art imputation methods used in the proposed method.
This paper introduces a widely used unsupervised anomaly detection method that serves as a baseline in this research, allowing for a comprehensive evaluation of the proposed method's performance.

references.paper_title: Estimating the support of a high-dimensional distribution
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical framework for anomaly detection, which is the foundation for many modern anomaly detection methods, including those used as baselines in this research.
